further.translation[0].definitions[0].de: more, or to a greater degree
further.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: A spokesman declined to comment until the evidence could be studied further.
The flavour of the wine is further improved during the aging period.
Whaling in Australia was stopped. But the Australian government went further (=said or did something more extreme) and proposed a global ban.
Marcus sank further and further into debt.
further.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a greater distance, or beyond a particular place
further.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: His farm is located further away from Riobamba than his brother’s.
His hands moved further down her back.
They’ve never been further south than San Diego.
further.translation[0].definitions[2].de: into the past or the future
further.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: It might be a sign, much further down the road (=in the future), of a change in policy.
Five years further on, a cure has still not been found.
The records don’t go any further back than 1960.
further.translation[0].definitions[3].de: used to introduce something additional that you want to talk about
further.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Butter sales have fallen because margarine has improved in flavor. Further, butter consumption has decreased because of links to heart disease.
further.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: We have decided to take no further action.
Visit our website for further details.
Cook gently for a further 10 minutes.
further.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to help something progress or be successful
further.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: He dedicated his life to furthering the cause of world peace.
Alan had been using her to further his career.
